content.description:
A good slab problem that requires good footwork and some confidence.

Start at the left end of the wave like roof.  Slap and smear your way to the first stance on the short flake feature.  Make thin moves up to the next bolt below the roof.  Figure out how to make the tough stand up to shoot for the jug at the roof.  Make a few more difficult moves to get above the roof and enjoy the easier slab to the last section of pockets.  Pull through moderate pockets on some steep terrain to get to the chains.
content.protection: QD's for 10 bolts to chain anchors.  The upper slab is over-bolted, so a few can be bypassed.
content.location: The route starts at the left end of the wave like roof feature and ends at yellow and brown pockets.  A 60m will get you down.

content.description: Right angling crack
content.location: Left of Banjolero

climbs.name: Whippoorwill
climbs.fa: Jeff Neal, Theresa Neal, Matt Johns (2009)

content.description:
Surmount the starting choss gate to gain a ledge. Start inching your way up the slab until you have no idea where the holds are and somehow keep going up. Eases up about halfway to fun, tech climbing on solid edges.

Definitely doesn't see much traffic, a lot of lichen and other fun things growing all over the face.
content.location: On the dirty slab wall in between where "Fairweather Friend" is and the easy trad / wave wall zone. Right of the two neighboring lines.

content.description:
From redriverclimbing:

15 feet right of the previous line is another crimp fest but with more holds than its neighbor. Begin on a ledge and step and reach up the slightly less than vertical face. Shift slightly left just before the shuts.
Climb the low angle widening crack in the dihedral on the left side of the recess just before A1A.
content.protection: The crack is fist to larger. There are bolt anchors before the ledge.
content.location: Hike right from the left end of the wall and find a recess with a few cracks. This is the left most route in the recess in a dihedral.

content.description: Walk downhill from June Bug to locate this striking line which climbs easier than it appears. Begin off the boulder on the left and climb up to a stance beneath the meat of the line. Take on the steep face making use of Scream-face holds to reach the obvious duck-bill feature. Shake out then make more big moves culminating in a desperate finale for the chains. No gigantic cheater slings on the anchors! Classic and makes a trip to the Crossroads well worth while
content.location: Furthest sport route to the right currently

content.description:
Similar to Buckwheats but steeper and the rock isn't as good of quality especially up high. There is lichen on the edges on the left face as well. Might clean up with traffic.

Take care with the finish. The gear is sparse and its not over when you reach the ledge.
content.protection: Small and medium gear. Bolt anchors.
content.location: Right of Buckwheats Climb for Stef and just before A1A.

content.description: Climb good ledges to fun slab moves. Finish on a monster bucket
content.location: Right of boiler plate

content.description:
This unique looking route offers a spectacular lower section with thoughtful moves and a cool roof.  Unfortunately, the second half is forgettable and sandy.

Delicate slab moves on maroon colored, alligator skin rock leads to a balancy stand up move to reach a good rail in the roof.  Ride the good holds to the crest of the wave-like roof and make a hard lock-off to gain better holds.  The final 40 feet is easy, but dirty slab with a short vertical section on big flakes.
content.protection: Bolt to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just right of Yell Fire.

content.description: Climb the thin crack as the wall kicks back vertically. Get in some good stemming moves, and then hand jam to the top. Although same anchors as Banjolero, for some spicier beta, wedge yourself into the crack at the top until gaining the ledge, don't clip the bolts on the other routes.
content.protection: Shares anchors with Banjolero. Used some small cams through mid way and a couple larger ones at the top.
content.location: Crack in between Banjolero and Deeznuts.

content.description: Climb the ribbed finger crack splitting the face at the very left end of the slab/wave wall. Somewhat insecure climbing through pods with marginal gear.
content.location: Up the hill from the wave wall, there is a pair of cracks where the two slab walls meet. Immediately right of the shallow dihedral flake, this climbs up the finger crack.

content.description: A classic overlooked face climb with thought provoking moves on a beautiful orange wall with unique holds. The start is a little slabby and awkward but quickly turns to excellent climbing on bullet hard sandstone. The crux is met at about 2/3 height
content.protection: 10 quick draws is all you need
content.location: Continue down the trail to the second point at which you can turn left towards the cliff. Located just to the right of the bolted corner "Fairweather Friend"

content.description: Forty feet of fun with a nice solid crux at the third clip
content.location: Left of Love Potion #9

content.description: Fun face climbing for the first half of the route, and sloping slots with tricky feet for the second half
content.location: Right of N4 at the start of the Crossroads

content.description: Continuous climbing through positive but sharp crimps, sidepulls and pinches.
content.location: First route from the left on the wall up the hill from Cannabis Love Generator and Love Potion #9

content.description:
For those who thought Crossroads was all slab. Right of Boilerplate is this steep and well featured face. Begin with some big move cruxes down low then continue up through steep jugs to the chains.

-From redriverclimbing
content.location: To the right of boilerplate and up the hill on the steep portion

content.description: Super cool features up a brilliant orange streak lead to a stout crimpy crux. Trend left at the 6th bolt to keep it at 12a.
content.location: Just right of Deeznuts, left of Boilerplate... obvious bright orange streak up a slightly overhanging wall.

content.description: Climb up to a ledge and scope out the vert golden wall above. Pull onto the face and bust through a couple tough pocket pulling sequences with poor feet, gunning for better holds above.
content.location: Between Fairweather Friend and October Sky, this route begins in a small alcove between two boulders.

content.description:
Start down low with some good holds. The second bolt looks high from the ground, but the climbing is easy to get there. Take on some tougher climbing involving long pulls on pockets to move through the middle of the climb. There are a couple of okay rests to recover at. From the last bolt, trend right on tough crimps to get to the anchor clip.

This route is in the guidebook as 11d, but might be a touch harder.
content.location: Just left of Cannabis Love Generator, this is the line just right of a wide crack that is just right of two slab lines (Wake and Bake and Legalize It).

content.description:
Start off the ledge with a tricky boulder to gain a collection of huecos. Exit into thin, parallel runnels going up the gold wall. Punch through crimpy sequences utilizing features on both sides until a final toss to the clipping jug.

Belaying on the ground, below the ledge, is recommended.
content.location: Climbs off the middle of the ledge between Wrong Turn and Banjolero. Access from either side and look for the obvious set of huecos half way up.

content.description:
A varied line that throws a little slab, stemming and pump at you.

Awkward pods and pockets on a slab lead to a mantle off some classically southern slopers.  Follow an easy corner with pockets in the crack until the angle steepens.  A brief stemming crux on scoops gains nice pockets to the top.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just left of October Sky.  Stats off a big mossy boulder.  Look for a corner/ramp up high.

content.description: Climb just right of a crack using face holds and and the crack to make it to a bulging feature just before the anchors.  This route can be climbed on gear.
content.location: Right of Banjolero and left of Jingus Khan, this route stays right of a crack feature.

content.description: This route begins with a fun reachy bouldery section at the bottom that moves into an easy jug haul at the end. The last bolt is a little bit runnout.
content.location: Just around the arete from Love Potion no.9. Start  near an old tree stump on a small plateau formed by an erosion control bar.

content.description:
From redriverclimbing:

Just right of the previous line is another overhanging pocketed line. Climb deep pockets to an obvious crux. Continue on jugs to the anchors or keep moving to the anchors on the previous line for more value.

This route is an obtuse flake/dihedral on the slab to the right of Turkey Crossing. Follow the crack to anchors hidden on the ledge.

The route climbs better and is better quality than it looks form the ground.
content.protection:
The pro is adequate, but you have to have some experience placing gear to get good placements. Mostly smaller stuff, from finger size to #0.75 Camalot size.

Bolt anchors on the ledge.
content.location: Middle of the slab right of Turkey Crossing.

content.description: Super fun climbing for the grade with everything from slab to slightly overhung. Heady, exposed feeling at the top (crux section)!
content.location: On the far right hand side of the Crossroads, up a steep trail, beginning on a ledge on the right side of the arete.

content.description:
A fun steep and pocketed route that saves the crux for the last move.

Start in a dihedral feature where left wall is covered in pockets.  Make the easy moves to get to the first bolts.  Get into the dihedral feature using and use the steep pockets to get through the next few bolts.  Move left at the top onto a flake feature on the left face.  Hurry up and make the last few tough moves before your arms give out and clip the anchors.
content.protection: QD's for 7 bolts and a two-bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This route starts in a alcove feature 50' left of Boilerplate.  Look for the obvious pockets left of a dihedral and a flake on the left face near the top.  A 60m will get you down.

content.description: Left-most bolted route on the face with the wave shaped roof. Crux is down low. Nice rock with fun moves.
